020import java.lang.constant.Constable;

026import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
027import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
028import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;

030import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;

056import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
057import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_boolean;
058import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_List;
059import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.FALSE;
060import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.TRUE;
061
062import static java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc.Kind.STATIC;
063
064import static org.microbean.type.ConstantDescs.CD_JavaType;
065import static org.microbean.type.ConstantDescs.CD_Type;

067/**
068 * A {@link org.microbean.type.Type} that models a {@link
069 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type} for use primarily by
070 * a {@link org.microbean.type.Type.Semantics} instance.
071 *
072 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
073 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
074 *
075 * @see org.microbean.type.Type.Semantics
076 */
077@Experimental
078public class JavaType extends org.microbean.type.Type<Type> implements Constable {
079
080
081  /*
082   * Instance fields.
083   */
084
085
086  private final boolean box;
087
088
089  /*
090   * Constructors.
091   */
092
093
094  /**
095   * Creates a new {@link JavaType}.
096   *
097   * @param box whether boxing of primitive types will be in effect;
098   * even if {@code true} boxing only happens to primitive types
099   *
100   * @param type the Java {@link Type} being modeled; must not be {@code null}
101   *
102   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
103   */
104  protected JavaType(final boolean box, final Type type) {
105    super(box ? JavaTypes.box(type) : type);
106    this.box = box;
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Creates a new {@link JavaType} that models custom supertypes.
111   *
112   * <p>Among other things, this means that the {@link #object()}
113   * method will return {@code null}.</p>
114   *
115   * @param box whether boxing of primitive types will be in effect;
116   * even if {@code true} boxing only happens to primitive types
117   *
118   * @param supertypes a {@link List} of supertypes; must not be
119   * {@code null}
120   *
121   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supertypes} is {@code
122   * null}
123   */
124  protected JavaType(final boolean box, final List<?> supertypes) {
125    super(map(supertypes, box ? JavaType::ofBoxed : JavaType::of));
126    this.box = box;
127  }
128
129
130  /*
131   * Instance methods.
132   */
133
134
135  /**
136   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
137   * represents a Java type that has a name.
138   *
139   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
140   * {@link TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
141   *
142   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType} represents
143   * a Java type that has a name
144   *
145   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
146   * idempotent and deterministic.
147   *
148   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
149   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
150   *
151   * @see #name()
152   *
153   * @see Class#getName()
154   *
155   * @see TypeVariable#getName()
156   */
157  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
158  public final boolean named() {
159    final Type type = this.object();
160    return type instanceof Class || type instanceof TypeVariable;
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the name of this {@link JavaType} if it has one
165   * <strong>or {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
166   *
167   * <p>Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type
168   * system have names.</p>
169   *
170   * @return the name of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null}
171   *
172   * @nullability This method and its overrides may, and often will,
173   * return {@code null}.
174   *
175   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent
176   * and deterministic.
177   *
178   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
179   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
180   */
181  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
182  public final String name() {
183    final Object type = this.object();
184    if (type == null) {
185      return null;
186    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
187      return c.getName();
188    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
189      return tv.getName();
190    }
191    return null;
192  }
193
194  /**
195   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the return value of {@link
196   * #object()} is identical to {@link Object Object.class}.
197   *
198   * @return {@code true} if and only if the return value of {@link
199   * #object()} is identical to {@link Object Object.class}
200   *
201   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
202   *
203   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
204   * threads.
205   */
206  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
207  public final boolean top() {
208    return this.object() == Object.class;
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Returns a {@link JavaType}, <strong>usually new</strong>, whose
213   * {@linkplain #object() modeled type} is {@linkplain
214   * JavaTypes#equals(Type, Type) equal to} the supplied {@link Type}.
215   *
216   * @param type the new {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
217   *
218   * @return a {@link JavaType}, usually new
219   *
220   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
221   *
222   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
223   * return {@code null}.
224   *
225   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
226   * idempotent and deterministic.
227   *
228   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
229   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
230   *
231   * @see #withBox(boolean)
232   *
233   * @see #of(boolean, Type)
234   */
235  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
236  public final JavaType withObject(final Type type) {
237    return of(this.box, type);
238  }
239
240  /**
241   * Returns a {@link JavaType}, <strong>usually new</strong>, whose
242   * boxing strategy is modeled by the supplied {@code boolean}.
243   *
244   * @param box the new boxing strategy
245   *
246   * @return a {@link JavaType}, usually new
247   *
248   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
249   * return {@code null}.
250   *
251   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
252   * idempotent and deterministic.
253   *
254   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
255   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
256   *
257   * @see #withObject(Type)
258   *
259   * @see #of(boolean, Type)
260   */
261  public final JavaType withBox(final boolean box) {
262    return of(box, this.object());
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * Returns an {@linkplain
267   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
268   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the computed <em>direct
269   * supertypes</em> of this {@link JavaType}, or an {@linkplain
270   * Collection#isEmpty() empty <code>List</code>} if there are
271   * no direct supertypes.
272   *
273   * <p>This implementation uses the {@link
274   * JavaTypes#directSupertypes(Type)} method.</p>
275   *
276   * @return an {@linkplain
277   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
278   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the computed <em>direct
279   * supertypes</em> of this {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
280   *
281   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
282   * return {@code null}.
283   *
284   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
285   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
286   *
287   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
288   * idempotent and deterministic.
289   */
290  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
291  protected final List<? extends org.microbean.type.Type<Type>> computeDirectSupertypes() {
292    final Type type = this.object();
293    return type == null ? List.of() : map(JavaTypes.directSupertypes(type), this::withObject);
294  }
295
296  /**
297   * If this {@link JavaType} represents a {@link ParameterizedType}
298   * or a {@link GenericArrayType} returns a {@link JavaType}
299   * representing its {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw
300   * type} or {@linkplain GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType()
301   * generic component type}, or, if this {@link JavaType} does not
302   * represent a {@link ParameterizedType} or a {@link
303   * GenericArrayType}, returns {@code this}.
304   *
305   * @return a suitable {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}; often {@code
306   * this}
307   *
308   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
309   * return {@code null}.
310   *
311   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
312   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
313   *
314   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
315   * idempotent and deterministic.
316   */
317  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
318  public final JavaType type() {
319    final Object type = this.object();
320    if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
321      return this.withObject(p.getRawType());
322    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
323      return this.withObject(g.getGenericComponentType());
324    } else {
325      return this;
326    }
327  }
328
329  /**
330   * Returns the owner of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null} if
331   * there is no such {@link Owner}.
332   *
333   * @return the owner of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null}
334   *
335   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
336   *
337   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
338   * threads.
339   *
340   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
341   */
342  @Experimental
343  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
344  public final Owner<Type> owner() {
345    final Object type = this.object();
346    if (type == null) {
347      return null;
348    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
349      final Class<?> enclosingClass = c.getEnclosingClass();
350      return enclosingClass == null ? null : this.withObject(enclosingClass);
351    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
352      final Type ownerType = p.getOwnerType();
353      return ownerType == null ? null : this.withObject(ownerType);
354    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
355      final GenericDeclaration gd = tv.getGenericDeclaration();
356      if (gd instanceof Class<?> c) {
357        return this.withObject(c);
358      } else if (gd instanceof Executable e) {
359        return new JavaExecutable(e, this.box);
360      } else {
361        throw new AssertionError("gd: " + gd);
362      }
363    } else {
364      return null;
365    }
366  }
367
368  /**
369   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
370   * represents a generic {@link Class} by virtue of having
371   * {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}.
372   *
373   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
374   * {@link #object()} is an instance of {@link Class} and, if so, if
375   * that {@link Class} {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() has any
376   * type parameters}.
377   *
378   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
379   * a generic class by virtue of having {@linkplain
380   * Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}
381   *
382   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
383   * threads.
384   *
385   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
386   *
387   * @see #object()
388   *
389   * @see #typeParameters()
390   */
391  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
392  public final boolean hasTypeParameters() {
393    return this.object() instanceof Class<?> c && c.getTypeParameters().length > 0;
394  }
395
396  /**
397   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
398   * a {@link ParameterizedType} by virtue of {@linkplain
399   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() having type
400   * arguments}.
401   *
402   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
403   * {@link #object()} is a {@link ParameterizedType}.</p>
404   *
405   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
406   * a parameterized type by virtue of having {@linkplain
407   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type arguments}
408   *
409   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
410   * threads.
411   *
412   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
413   *
414   * @see #object()
415   *
416   * @see #typeArguments()
417   */
418  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
419  public final boolean hasTypeArguments() {
420    return this.object() instanceof ParameterizedType;
421  }
422
423  /**
424   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
425   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s type
426   * arguments.
427   *
428   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
429   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link JavaType} models a
430   * {@link ParameterizedType}.</p>
431   *
432   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
433   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s
434   * {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type
435   * arguments}; never {@code null}
436   *
437   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
438   *
439   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
440   * threads.
441   *
442   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
443   */
444  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
445  public final List<? extends JavaType> typeArguments() {
446    return this.object() instanceof ParameterizedType p ? map(p.getActualTypeArguments(), this::withObject) : List.of();
447  }
448
449  /**
450   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
451   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s type
452   * parameters.
453   *
454   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
455   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link JavaType} models a generic
456   * {@link Class}.</p>
457   *
458   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
459   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s
460   * {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}; never
461   * {@code null}
462   *
463   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
464   *
465   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
466   * threads.
467   *
468   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
469   */
470  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
471  public final List<? extends JavaType> typeParameters() {
472    return this.object() instanceof Class<?> c ? map(c.getTypeParameters(), this::withObject) : List.of();
473  }
474
475  /**
476   * Returns the {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component type}
477   * of this {@link JavaType}, if there is one, <strong>or {@code
478   * null} if there is not</strong>.
479   *
480   * <p>This method returns a non-{@code null} result only when this
481   * {@link JavaType} represents a {@link Type} that is either
482   * {@linkplain Class#isArray() an array} or a {@link
483   * GenericArrayType}.</p>
484   *
485   * @return the {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component type}
486   * of this {@link JavaType}, if there is one, or {@code null} if
487   * there is not
488   *
489   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
490   *
491   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
492   * threads.
493   *
494   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
495   *
496   * @see Class#getComponentType()
497   *
498   * @see GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType()
499   */
500  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
501  public final JavaType componentType() {
502    Type type = this.object();
503    if (type == null) {
504      return null;
505    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
506      type = c.getComponentType();
507    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
508      type = g.getGenericComponentType();
509    } else {
510      return null;
511    }
512    return type == null ? null : this.withObject(type);
513  }
514
515  /**
516   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
517   * represents either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
518   * WildcardType}.
519   *
520   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
521   * {@link #object()} is either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
522   * WildcardType}.</p>
523   *
524   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
525   * represents either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
526   * WildcardType}
527   *
528   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
529   *
530   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
531   * threads.
532   *
533   * @see #upperBounds()
534   */
535  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
536  public final boolean upperBounded() {
537    final Object type = this.object();
538    return type instanceof WildcardType || type instanceof TypeVariable;
539  }
540
541  /**
542   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
543   * a {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
544   * with a lower bound}.
545   *
546   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
547   * {@link #object()} is a {@link WildcardType}, and, if so, if that
548   * {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
549   * has a lower bound}.</p>
550   *
551   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
552   * represents a {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain
553   * WildcardType#getLowerBounds() with a lower bound}
554   *
555   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
556   *
557   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
558   * threads.
559   *
560   * @see #lowerBounds()
561   *
562   * @see WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
563   */
564  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
565  public final boolean lowerBounded() {
566    return this.object() instanceof WildcardType w && w.getLowerBounds().length > 0;
567  }
568
569  /**
570   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
571   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
572   * bounds.
573   *
574   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
575   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a {@link
576   * WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds() with a
577   * lower bound}.</p>
578   *
579   * <p>The returned {@link List} will contain at most one
580   * element.</p>
581   *
582   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
583   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
584   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
585   * empty}
586   *
587   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
588   *
589   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
590   * threads.
591   *
592   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
593   *
594   * @see WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
595   */
596  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
597  public final List<? extends JavaType> lowerBounds() {
598    return this.object() instanceof WildcardType w ? map(w.getLowerBounds(), this::withObject) : List.of();
599  }
600
601  /**
602   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
603   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s upper
604   * bounds.
605   *
606   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
607   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a {@link
608   * WildcardType} or a {@link TypeVariable}.
609   *
610   * <p>The returned {@link List} will contain at most one
611   * element.</p>
612   *
613   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
614   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
615   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
616   * empty}
617   *
618   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
619   *
620   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
621   * threads.
622   *
623   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
624   *
625   * @see TypeVariable#getBounds()
626   *
627   * @see WildcardType#getUpperBounds()
628   */
629  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
630  public final List<? extends JavaType> upperBounds() {
631    final Object type = this.object();
632    if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
633      return map(w.getUpperBounds(), this::withObject);
634    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> t) {
635      return map(t.getBounds(), this::withObject);
636    }
637    return List.of();
638  }
639
640  @Override // Owner<Type>
641  public final boolean objectEquals(final Object other) {
642    return
643      this.object() == other ||
644      other instanceof Type && JavaTypes.equals(this.object(), this.box ? JavaTypes.box((Type)other) : (Type)other);
645  }
646
647  @Override // Constable
648  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
649    final ConstantDesc boxCd = this.box ? TRUE : FALSE;
650    if (this.customSupertyped()) {
651      final ConstantDesc supertypesCd = Constables.describeConstable(this.supertypes()).orElse(null);
652      if (supertypesCd != null) {
653        return
654          Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.of(BSM_INVOKE,
655                                             MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
656                                                                       CD_JavaType,
657                                                                       "ofExactly",
658                                                                       MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_JavaType, CD_boolean, CD_List)),
659                                             boxCd,
660                                             supertypesCd));
661      }
662    } else {
663      final Type object = this.object();
664      if (object != null) {
665        final ConstantDesc objectCd = JavaTypes.describeConstable(object).orElse(null);
666        if (objectCd != null) {
667          return
668            Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.of(BSM_INVOKE,
669                                               MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
670                                                                         CD_JavaType,
671                                                                         "of",
672                                                                         MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_JavaType, CD_Type)),
673                                               objectCd));
674        }
675      }
676    }
677    return Optional.empty();
678  }
679
680  /**
681   * Calls the {@link #object()} method and returns the result.
682   *
683   * @param classLoader ignored
684   *
685   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #object()} method
686   *
687   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
688   *
689   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
690   *
691   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
692   * threads.
693   */
694  @Experimental
695  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
696  public final Type load(final ClassLoader classLoader) {
697    return this.object();
698  }
699  
700  
701
702  /*
703   * Static methods.
704   */
705
706
707  /**
708   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the {@linkplain
709   * JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of the supplied {@link
710   * org.microbean.type.Type}'s {@linkplain #object() modeled type}
711   * {@linkplain Class#isInterface() is an interface}.
712   *
713   * <p>This method is most commonly used as a method reference
714   * supplied to an invocation of the {@link
715   * #mostSpecialized(Predicate)} method.</p>
716   *
717   * @param t a {@link org.microbean.type.Type} whose {@linkplain
718   * #object() modeled type} is a {@link Type java.lang.reflect.Type};
719   * must not be {@code null}
720   *
721   * @return {@code true} if and only if the {@linkplain
722   * JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of the supplied {@link
723   * org.microbean.type.Type}'s {@linkplain #object() modeled type}
724   * {@linkplain Class#isInterface() is an interface}
725   *
726   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
727   *
728   * @see #mostSpecialized(Predicate)
729   */
730  @Convenience
731  public static final boolean interfaceType(final org.microbean.type.Type<Type> t) {
732    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t.object());
733    return c != null && c.isInterface();
734  }
735
736  /**
737   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the {@linkplain
738   * JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of the supplied {@link
739   * org.microbean.type.Type}'s {@linkplain #object() modeled type}
740   * {@linkplain Class#isInterface() is not an interface}.
741   *
742   * <p>This method is most commonly used as a method reference
743   * supplied to an invocation of the {@link
744   * #mostSpecialized(Predicate)} method.</p>
745   *
746   * @param t a {@link org.microbean.type.Type} whose {@linkplain
747   * #object() modeled type} is a {@link Type java.lang.reflect.Type};
748   * must not be {@code null}
749   *
750   * @return {@code true} if and only if the {@linkplain
751   * JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of the supplied {@link
752   * org.microbean.type.Type}'s {@linkplain #object() modeled type}
753   * {@linkplain Class#isInterface() is not an interface}
754   *
755   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
756   *
757   * @see #mostSpecialized(Predicate)
758   */
759  @Convenience
760  public static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final org.microbean.type.Type<Type> t) {
761    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t.object());
762    return c != null && !c.isInterface();
763  }
764
765  private static final JavaType of(final Object o) {
766    return of(false, o);
767  }
768
769  private static final JavaType ofBoxed(final Object o) {
770    return of(true, o);
771  }
772
773  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
774  private static final JavaType of(final boolean box, final Object o) {
775    if (o instanceof Type type) {
776      return of(box, type);
777    } else if (o instanceof Token<?> token) {
778      return of(box, token);
779    } else if (o instanceof org.microbean.type.Type<?> type) {
780      return of(box, (org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type>)type);
781    } else {
782      throw new IllegalArgumentException();
783    }
784  }
785
786  /**
787   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
788   *
789   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the type to model; must
790   * not be {@code null}
791   *
792   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
793   *
794   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
795   *
796   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
797   *
798   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
799   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
800   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
801   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
802   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
803   * invocations are equal.
804   *
805   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
806   * threads.
807   *
808   * @see #of(boolean, Token)
809   */
810  public static final JavaType of(final Token<?> type) {
811    return of(false, type);
812  }

930  /**
931   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
932   *
933   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
934   *
935   * @param type the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} whose {@linkplain
936   * org.microbean.type.Type#object() represented <code>Type</code>}
937   * will be modeled; must not be {@code null}
938   *
939   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
940   *
941   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
942   *
943   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
944   *
945   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
946   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
947   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
948   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
949   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
950   * invocations are equal.
951   *
952   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
953   * threads.
954   *
955   * @see #of(boolean, Type)
956   */
957  public static final JavaType of(final boolean box, final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> type) {
958    if (type instanceof JavaType jt && box == jt.box) {
959      return jt;
960    }
961    return of(box, type.object());
962  }

1268
1269  /*
1270   * Inner and nested classes.
1271   */
1272
1273
1274  /**
1275   * A holder of a {@link Type} that embodies <a
1276   * href="http://gafter.blogspot.com/2006/12/super-type-tokens.html"
1277   * target="_parent">Gafter's gadget</a>.
1278   *
1279   * <p>To use this class, create a new instance of an anonymous
1280   * subclass of it, and then call {@link #type() type()} on it.  For
1281   * example:</p>
1282   *
1283   * <blockquote><pre>
1284   * // type will be a {@link ParameterizedType} whose {@link ParameterizedType#getRawType() rawType} is {@link java.util.List List.class} and
1285   * // whose {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() sole type argument} is {@link String String.class}
1286   * {@link Type} type = new {@link Token Token}&lt;{@link java.util.List List}&lt;{@link String}&gt;&gt;() {}.{@link #type() type()};</pre></blockquote>
1287   *
1288   * @param <T> the modeled type; often parameterized
1289   *
1290   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
1291   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
1292   *
1293   * @see #type()
1294   */
1295  public static abstract class Token<T> {
1296
1297
1298    /*
1299     * Instance fields.
1300     */
1301
1302
1303    private final Type type;
1304
1305
1306    /*
1307     * Constructors.
1308     */
1309
1310
1311    /**
1312     * Creates a new {@link Token}.
1313     */
1314    protected Token() {
1315      super();
1316      this.type = mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(this.getClass()).getActualTypeArguments()[0];
1317    }
1318
1319
1320    /*
1321     * Instance methods.
1322     */
1323
1324
1325    /**
1326     * Returns the {@link Type} modeled by this {@link Token}.
1327     *
1328     * @return the {@link Type} modeled by this {@link Token}; never
1329     * {@code null}
1330     *
1331     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1332     *
1333     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1334     * threads.
1335     *
1336     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1337     */
1338    public final Type type() {
1339      return this.type;
1340    }
1341
1342    /**
1343     * Returns the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of
1344     * this {@link Token}'s {@linkplain #type() modeled
1345     * <code>Type</code>}, or {@code null} if erasing the {@link Type}
1346     * would result in a non-{@link Class} erasure (in which case the
1347     * erasure is simply the {@link Type} itself), or if an erasure
1348     * cannot be determined.
1349     *
1350     * @return the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of
1351     * this {@link Token}'s {@linkplain #type() modeled
1352     * <code>Type</code>}, or {@code null} if erasing the {@link Type}
1353     * would result in a non-{@link Class} erasure, or if an erasure
1354     * cannot be determined
1355     *
1356     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1357     *
1358     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1359     * threads.
1360     *
1361     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1362     */
1363    public final Class<?> erase() {
1364      return JavaTypes.erase(this.type());
1365    }
1366
1367    /**
1368     * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Token} computed from the
1369     * {@link Type} it {@linkplain #type() models}.
1370     *
1371     * @return a hashcode for this {@link Token}
1372     *
1373     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1374     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1375     *
1376     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1377     * idempotent and deterministic.
1378     *
1379     * @see #equals(Object)
1380     */
1381    @Override // Object
1382    public int hashCode() {
1383      final Type type = this.type();
1384      return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
1385    }
1386
1387    /**
1388     * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1389     * this {@link Token}.
1390     *
1391     * <p>This method returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link
1392     * Object}'s {@linkplain Object#getClass() class} is this {@link
1393     * Token}'s class and if its {@linkplain #type() modeled
1394     * <code>Type</code>} is equal to this {@link Token}'s
1395     * {@linkplain #type() modeled <code>Type</code>}.</p>
1396     *
1397     * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null} in
1398     * which case {@code false} will be returned
1399     *
1400     * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1401     * this {@link Token}; {@code false} otherwise
1402     *
1403     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1404     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1405     *
1406     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1407     * idempotent and deterministic.
1408     *
1409     * @see #hashCode()
1410     */
1411    @Override // Object
1412    public boolean equals(final Object other) {
1413      if (other == this) {
1414        return true;
1415      } else if (other instanceof Token<?> tt) {
1416        return Objects.equals(this.type(), tt.type());
1417      } else {
1418        return false;
1419      }
1420    }
1421
1422    /**
1423     * Returns a {@link String} representation of this {@link
1424     * Token}.
1425     *
1426     * <p>This method returns a value equal to that returned by {@link
1427     * Type#getTypeName() this.type().getTypeName()}.</p>
1428     *
1429     * @return a {@link String} representation of this {@link
1430     * Token}; never {@code null}
1431     *
1432     * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
1433     * return {@code null}.
1434     *
1435     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1436     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1437     *
1438     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1439     * idempotent and deterministic.
1440     */
1441    @Override // Object
1442    public String toString() {
1443      final Type type = this.type();
1444      return type == null ? "null" : type.getTypeName();
1445    }
1446
1447
1448    /*
1449     * Static methods.
1450     */
1451
1452
1453    private static final ParameterizedType mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(final Type type) {
1454      if (type == null || type == Object.class || type == Token.class) {
1455        return null;
1456      } else {
1457        final Class<?> erasure = JavaTypes.erase(type);
1458        if (erasure == null || erasure == Object.class || !(Token.class.isAssignableFrom(erasure))) {
1459          return null;
1460        } else {
1461          return type instanceof ParameterizedType p ? p : mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(erasure.getGenericSuperclass());
1462        }
1463      }
1464    }
1465
1466  }
1467
1468}
